elements.title: Adriana Salvatierra (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Adriana Salvatierra (pictured), the youngest legislator to preside over the Bolivian Senate, accompanied her father to trade-union meetings while still a child?

elements.title: Streets of New Capenna (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the design of the Magic: The Gathering expansion set Streets of New Capenna is inspired by the Five Families of organized crime?

elements.title: embassy of the Philippines in Lisbon (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that protesters demanded the closure of the embassy of the Philippines in Lisbon?

elements.title: House of Awakened Culture (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Suquamish tribe opened their community house, the House of Awakened Culture, in 2009?

elements.title: The Maiden in the Tower (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that The Maiden in the Tower, the only opera by Jean Sibelius, was withdrawn after only three performances with the intention to revise it, which never happened?

elements.title: Wes Freed (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Wes Freed was the secretary of Future Farmers of America before becoming the album cover artist for the Drive-By Truckers?

elements.title: Die Brennessel (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Die Brennessel was a satirical magazine devised by the Nazi Party as a propaganda tool?

elements.title: IBM PS/2 Model 25 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that when a computer journalist saw the IBM PS/2 Model 25 for the first time, he thought that he "was looking at a deformed Macintosh"?
